To customize the appearance of the control, set the properties of the object returned by the property. To perform other initialization, cast the value of the property to the specific control type and access the members directly. For example, you can handle this event to attach event-handlers to the events of the editing control.

If the DataSet contains multiple tables, you must set this property to the name of one of the tables.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint
member.summary: Represents a class that provides the native methods for Painting.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.DeleteObject(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The DeleteObject function deletes a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette, freeing all system resources associated with the object. After the object is deleted, the specified handle is no longer valid.
member.param: A handle to a logical pen, brush, font, bitmap, region, or palette.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero, else return zero.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.CreateBitmap(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int16[])
member.summary: This function creates a bitmap with the specified width, height, and color format (color planes and bits-per-pixel).
member.param: The bitmap width, in pixels.
The bitmap height, in pixels.
The number of color planes used by the device.
The number of bits required to identify the color of a single pixel.

A pointer to an array of color data used to set the colors in a rectangle of pixels. Each scan line in the rectangle must be word aligned (scan lines that are not word aligned must be padded with zeros). If this parameter is NULL, the contents of the new bitmap is undefined.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to a bitmap. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.SelectObject(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The SelectObject function selects an object into the specified device context (DC). The new object replaces the previous object of the same type.
member.param: A handle to the DC.
A handle to the object to be selected.
member.returns: If the selected object is not a region and the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the object being replaced. If the selected object is a region and the function succeeds, the return value is one of the following values.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.ExcludeClipRect(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function creates a new clipping region that consists of the existing clipping region minus the specified rectangle.
member.param: A handle to the device context.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the rectangle.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the lower-right corner of the rectangle.
member.returns: The return value specifies the new clipping region's complexity

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.BitBlt(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method performs a bit-block transfer of the color data corresponding to a rectangle of pixels from the specified source device context into a destination device context.
member.param: A handle to the destination device context.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the destination rectangle.
The width, in logical units, of the source and destination rectangles.
The height, in logical units, of the source and the destination rectangles.
A handle to the source device context.
The x-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.
The y-coordinate, in logical units, of the upper-left corner of the source rectangle.
A raster-operation code. These codes define how the color data for the source rectangle is to be combined with the color data for the destination rectangle to achieve the final color.
member.returns: If the function succeeds the return value is nonzero, otherwise zero

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.CreateCompatibleBitmap(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function creates a bitmap compatible with the device that is associated with the specified device context.
member.param: A handle to a device context.
The bitmap width, in pixels.
The bitmap height, in pixels.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the compatible bitmap (DDB). If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.CreateCompatibleDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function creates a memory device context (DC) compatible with the specified device.
member.param: A handle to an existing DC. If this handle is NULL, the function creates a memory DC compatible with the application's current screen.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the handle to a memory DC. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.GetWindowDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: This function retrieves the device context (DC) for the entire window, including title bar, menus, and scroll bars. A window device context permits painting anywhere in a window, because the origin of the device context is the upper-left corner of the window instead of the client area.
member.param: A handle to the window with a device context that is to be retrieved.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to a device context for the specified window. If the function fails, the return value is NULL, indicating an error or an invalid windows handle parameter.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.GetWindowRect(System.IntPtr,Syncfusion.WinForms.Core.NativePaint.RECT@)
member.summary: Retrieves the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.
member.param: A handle to the window.
A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero, otherwise return zero.

member.name: M:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Helpers.NativePaint.SendMessage(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sends the specified message to a window or windows. The SendMessage function calls the window procedure for the specified window and does not return until the window procedure has processed the message.
member.param: A handle to the window whose window procedure will receive the message.
The message to be sent.
Additional message-specific information.
A Additional message-specific information.
member.returns: The return value specifies the result of the message processing; it depends on the message sent.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoGenerateColumnsMode.RetainOld
member.summary: Generates the columns based on the properties defined in the underlying data object, when the SFDataGrid doesn’t have an explicit column definition.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoGenerateColumnsMode.ResetAll
member.summary: Generates the columns based on the properties defined in the underlying data object.

member.summary: Generates the columns based on the explicit column definition in SFDataGrid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoGenerateColumnsMode.SmartReset
member.summary: Generates the columns and retains data operation based on the properties defined in underlying data object.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode
member.summary: Defines the constants that specifies how the width of the columns are adjusted.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.None
member.summary: No sizing. Default column width or defined width set to column.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.AllCells
member.summary: Calculates the width of column based on header and cell contents. So that header and cell content’s are not truncated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.LastColumnFill
member.summary: Applies AutoSizeColumnsMode.AllCells width to all the columns except last column which is visible and the remaining width from total width of SfDataGrid is set to last column.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.AllCellsWithLastColumnFill
member.summary: Applies AutoSizeColumnsMode.AllCells width to all the columns except last column which is visible and sets the maximum between last column auto spacing width and remaining width to last column.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.AllCellsExceptHeader
member.summary: Calculates the width of column based on cell contents. So that cell content’s are not truncated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.ColumnHeader
member.summary: Calculates the width of column based on header content. So that header content is not truncated.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeColumnsMode.Fill
member.summary: Divides the total width equally for columns.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeRange
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify the auto sizing range of the columns.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeRange.Table
member.summary: Specifies that the auto sizing of columns should consider all the rows in the grid.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeRange.VisibleRows
member.summary: Specifies that the auto sizing of columns should consider visible rows only in the grid.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeCalculationMode
member.summary: Defines the constants that specify the mode to measure the width cell based on its content.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeCalculationMode.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the cell size is calculated by calculating and comparing the size of the text in a cell.

member.name: F:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Enums.AutoSizeCalculationMode.SmartFit
member.summary: Specifies that the cell size is calculated by calculating the string width of the longest string (maximum length) in a column.
member.remarks: By this way, the width will not be calculated for each cell and width is calculated for longest string alone. If '\n' exists in the cell content, the cell value will be splitted with '\n' and checks the maximum string length among the splitted string collection and calculates the width of the cell based on maximum string length found among the splitted string collection.

member.name: P:Syncfusion.WinForms.GridCommon.FilterControlBase.CanOverrideStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether control elements styles can be overridden by theme style settings.
member.value: Default value is false.
member.remarks: By default, the control's element styles will not be overridden by theme style settings if the style is set in sample level. If this property is enabled, element style will be overridden by theme style settings event if it is set in sample level. This property should be enabled or disabled before calling the ThemeName property of the control.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Styles.DataGridStyleInfoSubObject
member.summary: is an abstract base class for classes to be used as sub-objects in a .
member.remarks:
is derived from
and thus provides the same easy way to provide properties that can inherit values from base styles at run-time.
The difference is that supports this inheritance mechanism as a sub-object from a . A sub-object needs to have knowledge about its parent object and be able to walk the base styles from the parent object.
Examples for implementation of are the font and border classes in Essential Grid.
Programmers can derive their own style classes from
and add type-safe supported custom properties to the style class. If you write your own SpinButton class that needs individual properties, simply add a CellSpinButtonInfo class as sub object. If you derive CellSpinButtonInfo from DataGridStyleInfoSubObject, your new object will support property inheritance from base styles.
See the overview for for further discussion about style objects.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataGrid.Styles.GridBorderSide
member.summary: Defines the constants that specifies the sides of a rectangle which applies the border.

summary.para: A three-dimensional border on the left edge of the control.
A three-dimensional border on the top edge of the rectangle.
A three-dimensional border on the right side of the rectangle.
A three-dimensional border on the bottom side of the rectangle.
A three-dimensional border on all four edges and fill the middle of the rectangle with the color defined for three-dimensional controls.

member.name: T:Syncfusion.WinForms.DataPager.SfDataPager
member.summary: Represents a control that provides the support to view the records in multiple pages.
member.remarks: You can bind the SfDataPager to any collection. The SfDataPager control wraps the collection internally in PagedCollectionView and exposes by using PagedSource property. PagedCollectionView helps to provide the paging functionality. You can apply paging for data bound control by setting PagedSource property as DataSource for that control.
